Eligibility: Patients undergoing mastectomy surgery with immediate reconstruction involving the insertion of a tissue extensor performed by the principal investigator from the time of approval of the study to the time of enrolment in the study is completed.
Patients under 18 years of age or over 79 years of age
Allergy to local anesthetics or corticosteroids
Patients with a history of chronic pain or chronic use of opioid analgesics
Patients with a history of pulmonary disease or anterior thoracotomy or median sternotomy
Results: Performance measures:
Quality of recovery score

The main measure of results is a well-validated and widely used survey that measures the quality of recovery from anesthesia, entitled "Global 40 Item Quality of Recovery" Survey. It is a survey of 40 questions administered to patients to enable them to assess their recovery quality in a number of dimensions, including emotional condition, physical comfort, psychological support, physical independence and pain. The score ranges from 40 to 200, with 40 representing a very poor overall recovery quality and 200 representing the best recovery possible. The following reference explains in detail the Global 40 Item Quality of Recovery survey:
Myles, P.S., et al., Validity and reliability of a postoperative recovery quality: the QoR-40. Br J Anaesth, 2000. 84(1): p. 11-5.
